value: caption=The sea front at Budleigh Salterton, looking west. The red cliffs visible are 200-250 million years old formed when the area was a desert.

Budleigh Salterton is a small town situated on East Devon's
, it is also situated within the East Devon Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty
Budleigh Salterton is about 11 miles from the M5 Motorway (Junction 30), follow the A376 towards
, then the B3179 to Budleigh Salterton, From the east, take the A3052 followed by B3178
Budleigh Salterton is served by buses from
(Route 157) and Exmouth (Routes 157 & 357). There are also two services a day from
(Route 58) timed for workers in the city.
The nearest rail station is Exmouth. (approx 5 miles away)
The nearest airport is Exeter Airport.
The town is relatively compact, though there are some steep hills. The 357 bus operates a loop around the town every hour during the day.

value: content=The town museum has exhibits about the geography and history of the town
content=The town has a pebble beach, the western most end is designated for naturists.

The South West Coast Path runs through the town offering spectacular cliff top views.
The area code for Budleigh Salterton is 01395. Mobile phone reception can be patchy
The nearby town of Exmouth has a sandy beach
